page.title: 03FARM USE OF FIELDS
page.content: Average size of field is 7 h. The boundaries are hedges,predominantly blackthorn, whitethorn and hazel, and Cotswold stone walls. {Soil types range through limestone, Cotswold brash, sandy loam to clay. Mains water is laid on to most enclosures. Several small paddocks are owned by or let to horse and pony owners. There is a small market garden and three stable establishments. All the farms have a good range of{buildings, {barns,}cow-houses and multipurpose sheds and 7 farms milk a dairy of British Friesian cows in milking parlours. Few bulls are kept, most farmers use the Artificial Insemination Service run by the Milk Marketing Board, which is centred 7 miles away.
